author: Meka

review: We loved our Roku so much that we decided to get Chromecast because it streams slightly different stuff. Whereas the Roku was simple to install with outstanding results, we can't get the Chromecast to do anything.  And we bought and have read the book.  We are working from a Windows 7 laptop.  Clearly the dongle is able to connect with our wifi router because it was able to discover its password and put up a nice screen with pretty photographs that change every so often.  We were able to reboot it, but couldn't figure out how to get anything but nice pictures.  Maybe someone can help me with this problem, but until I can get it to work it will be a thumbs down from me.

review: I got tired of paying $100+ per month for cable/satellite TV when my husband and I watch very little, and when we did watch it wasn't at the times the shows in which we were interested were airing.  I ditched the cable, got Hulu+ and Chromecast, and immediately realized that we aren't missing anything by not having cable.  It also broadcasts music.  This is my second one for my home gym.

review: No issues with netfilx and HBOGO, both play flawless HD on my TV.  Not great for broadcasting directly from the Chrome Browser, but still works.  In a few months there will be several more chromecast optimized apps making this even more valuable.  And considering the price, this is why it gets 5 stars from me.
